channel.title: Counter-strike: Global Offensive announced
channel.description:
http://store.steampowered.com/app/1800/
Counter-Strike: Global Offensive (CS: GO) will expand upon the team-based action gameplay that it pioneered when it was launched 12 years ago. CS: GO features new maps, characters, and weapons and delivers updated versions of the classic CS content (de_dust, etc.). In addition, CS: GO will introduce new gameplay modes, matchmaking, leader boards, and more. "Counter-Strike took the gaming industry by surprise when the unlikely MOD became the most played online PC action game in the world almost immediately after its release in August 1999," said Doug Lombardi at Valve. "For the past 12 years, it has continued to be one of the most-played games in the world, headline competitive gaming tournaments and selling over 25 million units worldwide across the franchise. CS: GO promises to expand on CS' award-winning gameplay and deliver it to gamers on the PC as well as the next gen consoles and the Mac." CS: GO is being developed by Valve in cooperation with Seattle-based Hidden Path Entertainment. The title is targeted for release in early 2012 and will be playable at this year's PAX Prime and London Games Festival.

item.title: Counter-strike: Global Offensive announced
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:12, topic:409709”]Wait will pc be able to play against console on the same servers?

You guys said you can’t wait for it to go to consoles so you can own console noobs… but you’d be using a console to play against them.[/quote]
using a PC to play against them*

Read full topic

item.title: Counter-strike: Global Offensive announced
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

I know, CS:GO will have cross-platform play on PS3 -> PC.

Also, the PS3 version will have keyboard and mouse support, which I did forget about.

Read full topic

item.title: Counter-strike: Global Offensive announced
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

PS3 and PC have cross-platform play via Steam, just like Portal 2 did.

Though, PS3 players may not be able to go on to the custom PC servers (due to mods, custom maps, etc) and while Valve did say the steamworks integrations on the PS3 could potentially bring a way to deliver mods, they already said they won’t be having custom or player hosted servers on consoles, only on PC.

Read full topic

item.title: Counter-strike: Global Offensive announced

item.description:

Wait will pc be able to play against console on the same servers?

You guys said you can’t wait for it to go to consoles so you can own console noobs… but you’d be using a console to play against them.

item.dc:creator: @eczema3 eczema3
item.description:
@eczema3 wrote:

Also frell, have you even seen pro cs: s players? they’re fucking ridiculous at how fast they can accurately aim/shoot. there’s no way in hell you’d find that kind of accuracy/speed in console

Read full topic

item.title: Counter-strike: Global Offensive announced
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:8, topic:409709”][quote author=eczema3 link=topic=510986.msg3727888#msg3727888 date=1314413561]
apparently cross platform… i cant wait to shit on console fgts
[/quote]
Platform makes no difference honestly, unless you just mean casual gamers who arent big computer nerds and play for fun once a week?[/quote]

Pad vs Mouse. Mouse is far more accurate and generally, the games are quite paced faster due to that on PC games. It’s part of the reason I find playing FPS games on consoles so dull, at least the twitch based shooters, or ones that try to be, like CoD, it feels so slow on consoles. Everything about it. No, it isn’t just sensitivity.

Read full topic
